head.title: HEWLETT IN STOCK DEAL FOR BLUESTONE

hedline.hl1: HEWLETT IN STOCK DEAL FOR BLUESTONE

abstract.p: Hewlett-Packard acquires Bluestone Software for about $467 million in stock; Bluestone reports net loss of $7 million on sales of $11.6 million for third quarter; graph (S)

block.p: In a move aimed at bolstering its electronic business capabilities, Hewlett-Packard said yesterday that it had agreed to acquire Bluestone Software for about $467 million in stock. Bluestone, based in Philadelphia, makes Internet technologies for business-to-business, business-to-consumer and mobile transactions. Hewlett-Packard said it would pay 0.2433 share for each share of Bluestone. Shares of Hewlett-Packard dropped $6.38, to $92, while Bluestone jumped $1.25 to $23.19. Earlier, Bluestone reported a net loss of $7 million, or 33 cents a share, on sales of $11.6 million for the third quarter.
